title: OnZen
author: OnZen
content: Recently OgNasty bitcointalk account password changed and OgNasty can not Access his Bitcoin acount ...

comments.author: joker_josue
comments.body: Quote from: OnZen on March 15, 2023, 07:53:33 AMRecently OgNasty bitcointalk account password changed and OgNasty can not Access his Bitcoin acount ... What does one thing have to do with another?Was it OgNasty who said it was hacked?He may have changed his own password. It's not wrong, and sometimes it can even be good, from time to time to change the password.

comments.author: Little Mouse
comments.body: Password reset doesn't mean this was a hack. If it was a change in the email address, then you may claim so. And where did he say he can't access his Bitcoin account, which account are you referring by the way? I can't see enough information in your claim. I don't think it was a hack, rather it's a normal password reset which everyone should do (change) once in month or a few months at least.

comments.author: Rikafip
comments.body: If password reset is the only "proof" that you have, you shouldn't have waisted your time and forum space with this report but I guess you don't have anything better to do since you got busted for cheating in that pie baking contest.

comments.author: hugeblack
comments.body: If it has been hacked, OgNasty is an active member, so he will appear in the forum will sign a message.It could make sense if he decided to sell his account, but I don't think he would.What are the reasons that led you to believe that it was hacked?

comments.author: Cantsay
comments.body: Op, this is not the first OG has changed his password you can check his security log down below and please you proceed to create more threads accusing others falsely make sure you do proper research so you won't end up making a fool of yourself. Bpip.orgBtw what motivated you into creating this thread?

comments.author: PX-Z
comments.body: Quote from: OnZen on March 15, 2023, 07:53:33 AMRecently OgNasty bitcointalk account password changed and OgNasty can not Access his Bitcoin acount ... First, having such status doesn't mean the account is hacked, unless the account started posting scams, phoenix miners, ponzi scheme investments, etc.Second, it's not bitcoin, its bitcointalk account, there is no such thing as bitcoin account.Third, wait until some alt posting as og that his account here in meta board for awareness that the account might post or PM sheyts.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: It is one of signal of changes in one account but it is not enough to call that account is hacked.Usually if an account is hacked, there would be more changes like email changed, captcha code change, posting style change, language change.Password changed / Woke up recently. Good signals to know potential scammers

comments.author: yahoo62278
comments.body: Cheating in the pie contest and tagged. Now trying to call out a user for changing his password. What's next? It's perfectly fine for users to change their passwords from time to time. In fact, it's actually probably encouraged to do so to protect your account.

comments.author: Daniel91
comments.body: When I saw the title, I thought it was about some serious attempt to hack the account of a respected member of this forum, but now I see that it is a frivolous attempt to attract attention.Changing passwords should actually be a common practice of every member of this forum for security reasons, and conclusions about account hacking should be based on very serious facts and reasons.After all, OgNasty has been a member of this forum for a long time and if someone really hacked his account, he would be able to solve it himself, with the forum admins and in silence, without unnecessary public attention  I suggest that the OP locks this unnecessary topic.

comments.author: tbct_mt2
comments.body: Quote from: Daniel91 on March 15, 2023, 11:32:46 AMWhen I saw the title, I thought it was about some serious attempt to hack the account of a respected member of this forum, but now I see that it is a frivolous attempt to attract attention.If OgNasty account was hacked, it will be a big alarm because he is one of co-signers of the forum multi-signature wallet.Months ago, a senior developer, Luke Jr. was hacked that triggered an alarm and theymos removed Luke Jr. as one of forum staffs.Forum funds.There was a reshuffle of forum fund co-signers, in 2020, OgNasty was one of co-signers.https://web.archive.org/web/20200609174026/https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=155000.0

comments.author: Adbitco
comments.body: It's natural for one to change his password for safer reason, if you keep counting on people's changing their password meaning 60% of users here have been also hacked as well, so I will advise you don't pay attention to people's profile more especially when you have no proof or no strong evidence to show up. You can only report an account whenever you noticed unusual activity like such user using it to scam people and posting a ponzi scheme and you confirmed it wasn't the original user then you may come up with your claims.

comments.author: cryptoaddictchie
comments.body: Very shallow to assume that. Some here often change passwords to protect their accounts for such breach and changing passwords are helpful to make your account protection stronger. If its a reason for such hack then ultimately many old members has been flagged as hacked accounts already.

comments.author: Plaguedeath
comments.body: Don't need to waste your time to feed this scammer, he's tried to cheat a pie contest by using someone pie and claimed if it's created by him [1] since the @OP is a scammer, why we should trust any words come from a scammer?@OP take your time, if OgNasty was got hacked we will see someone create a post in scam accusation section, but until now it's still nothing.[1] https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5439781.msg61894580#msg61894580

comments.author: Majestic-milf
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on March 15, 2023, 10:14:31 AMCheating in the pie contest and tagged. Now trying to call out a user for changing his password. What's next? It's perfectly fine for users to change their passwords from time to time. In fact, it's actually probably encouraged to do so to protect your account.  Well I guess this is the guy's way of gaining clout or trying to atone for his first misdemeanor but alas, he just proved his naivety and inability to do some research before spreading bullcrap about an OG like Ognasty! I say we just blame this title on the cluelessness of the poster and nothing more.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: yahoo62278 on March 15, 2023, 10:14:31 AMCheating in the pie contest and tagged. Now trying to call out a user for changing his password. What's next? It's perfectly fine for users to change their passwords from time to time. In fact, it's actually probably encouraged to do so to protect your account. He's a pretty lazy and cunning guy. I first noticed him in the knowledge quiz forum, where he tried to get merit twice because GazetaBitcoin created a very convenient topic for getting merit.https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5381367.msg61869752#msg61869752Today's topic is that he is looking for places where he can get a couple of merits and create a scandal. You can guess that he is not a beginner, since he so deftly grasps where you can get easy merit. The negative tag, I think, will only create a reason for the birth of a new profile of this liar.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.created_time: March 15, 2023, 03:36:13 PMLast edit: March 15, 2023, 04:04:56 PM by OgNasty
comments.body: LOL. I didn’t get hacked. I just upgraded my security a bit and felt the need to use fresh passwords with the new setup. I am a bit shocked that me changing my password warrants anyone making a thread. I’m even surprised that anyone noticed. I wish people paid as much attention to the positive things I did as they do to me changing my password. False alarm. Don’t worry, I’m still just as nasty as ever. Edit: Someone claims in this thread that I’m a signer on the forum’s multisig treasury wallet. This is false. I am no longer employed by this forum.

comments.author: dkbit98
comments.body: OgNasty is hacked but in his head only... he is so cringe and pathetic that sometimes I want to puke reading his hypocritical posts, now he is asking for people to apologize to him and he is happy for CM being sized, typical tesla boy... I wonder if he is going to be happy when someone (read government) seize his property, house and car so he can be even more happy and own nothing.

comments.author: Hispo
comments.body: I was not initially to post anything since this issue has apparently been cleared up. (Someone could go further and ask OgNasty for a signed message, but I doubt it would be necessary, considering there was not change of email).However, I must say that someone being as lazy and deceitful to try to allegedly cheat a pie baking contest on internet with stock images is a new low I did not expect to see around here.  Certainly deserving of a red tag.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Quote from: dkbit98 on March 15, 2023, 04:15:27 PMOgNasty is hacked but in his head only... he is so cringe and pathetic that sometimes I want to puke reading his hypocritical posts, now he is asking for people to apologize to him and he is happy for CM being sized, typical tesla boy... I wonder if he is going to be happy when someone (read government) seize his property, house and car so he can be even more happy and own nothing.  Tell me you’re mad about having your signature campaign payments shut down for promoting illegal money laundering activity to scammers on this forum for personal profits without telling me you’re mad about having your signature campaign payments shut down for promoting illegal money laundering activity to scammers on this forum for personal profits.
